articles.author: Carolyn Y. Johnson
articles.title: Blood tests show potential for predicting start of Alzheimer’s symptoms - The Washington Post
articles.description: The technique is not yet precise enough to predict a patient’s exact trajectory but could help find long-sought preventive treatment.
articles.content: Scientists showed in a new study published Thursday that they could use blood draws to build a clock for Alzheimers disease that could roughly predict whensymptoms will develop, findings that could e… [+60 chars]

articles.title: NASA’s Perseverance Now Autonomously Pinpoints Its Location on Mars - NASA (.gov)
articles.description: There is no GPS at the Red Planet, but a new technology called Mars Global Localization lets Perseverance determine precisely where it is — without human
articles.content:
